utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s going on with that woman you’re dating?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I broke up with her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She said she didn’t want to see me any more and I found that insulting.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I thought things were going well. What happened?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know, she didn’t even give me a reason.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s not a problem, we can figure this out. What are the reasons women reject Raj?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can we not play this game?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Doesn’t like games. That’s one.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ignore him. Yeah, sorry about the breakup.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s okay, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course you’re fine. Not every member of a species finds a mate. Sir Isaac Newton died a virgin, look at the contributions he made.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m not a virgin, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So now you think you’re better than Isaac Newton? Oh, no wonder women don’t like you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re not being very nice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What? He said he was fine.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sometimes people say things they don’t mean.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that’s a paradox. I mean if you meant what you just said, then that means you may not have meant what you just said.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Careful, I saw this on Star Trek. Smoke’s gonna come out of his ears soon. Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, boys. How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I thought we were having a nice conversation, but it turns out I was being offensive.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, normal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, what did you do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We were discussing Raj’s recent breakup and apparently, I was insensitive to him.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s okay, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t fall for it. He’ll get you to compare him to a dead virgin, and suddenly you’re the bad guy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon, when I said I was fine, I meant I didn’t want to talk about it any more.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then why didn’t you say that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Because that’s not what people do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I would prefer if people told me exactly what is on their mind.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. No, you don’t, you really don’t. I actually can’t say don’t enough.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it certainly would be easier. You have no idea what it’s like to struggle with recognizing emotional cues.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sure it’s extremely frustrating.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And also a little sad.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, now you’re just showing off.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, I just read that a team at MIT. developed a device that helps people read human emotions.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And you think we can get those guys to reprogram Sheldon? Cool.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s supposed to be accurate, like, 85% of the time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, I find that hard to believe.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That a bunch of awkward scientists with no social skills would invent a machine to do it for them?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I take it back. I believe it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You if it’s at MIT, I can make some calls. Maybe we can get Sheldon a prototype.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A machine that reads emotions is intriguing. It could help me be a more considerate friend.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wouldn’t that be nice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It could also help me identify my enemies, discover their fears and then I could use those fears to destroy them.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I like the first one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Now that Sheldon’s across the hall, have you decided what you’re doing with his old room?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was thinking maybe a library or a gaming room.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You could make it a train room.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t like trains. You like trains.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know, and Amy says I can’t have a train room.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, I just heard from the guys at MIT about that emotion reader. They’re sending a prototype for you to beta test.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wonderful. Although I’m not sure how I feel about being used as a guinea pig.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, when you get the machine, you can find out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe I could use it to understand why women keep dumping me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, you don’t need a machine for that, just send a survey card to all your ex-girlfriends and tell them if they fill it out they might win a prize.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s actually not a bad idea. Maybe I could even get them all together, sort of like a, a focus group, to find out what’s wrong with me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, Raj, that’s a terrible idea.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I was joking.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? Uh, little tip: jokes are often better when you end them with wocka wocka or ha-cha-cha.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, great news. The TV I want will fit in the gaming room, and if I leave the curtains open, I can watch it from work.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, can you hold off redoing the room? My brother’s coming out here in a few weeks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Yeah. Okay, sure. What’s going on with your brother?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: My dad asked if I can get him a job interview at my work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Huh. Is that a good idea? I mean, you think they’ll consider someone who was in prison for selling drugs?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I sell pharmaceuticals. That’s just a really hard to spell word for drugs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I’m sure he’ll appreciate carrying his samples in a briefcase instead of his colon. How long do you think he’ll stay?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I, I’m not sure. Maybe a few days. Unless he gets the job, then who knows?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hmm. Who knows? That’s exciting. I’ll get to wake up every morning and see if he’s still here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You don’t have a problem with this, do you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course not. I mean, he’s your brother.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Thank you, you’re the best. Mm.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Remember that when the new TV falls off the wall and crushes us both.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: This thing’s pretty cool. It interprets emotions using a wireless signal to analyse subtle changes in breathing and heart rate.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s amazing a machine can do that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Now, when the robots rise up, they’ll know that I’ve been rooting for them the whole time.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The display is synced to your phone. Give it a try.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right. Now, I’m gonna look at some pictures to prompt an emotional response, and we’ll see if the machine can identify them accurately.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, remember, it can only detect happy, sad, angry and excited. Not other things you’re feeling, like, what have I done with my life?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, I’m looking at the first picture.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You are happy?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes. I’m looking at puppi

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aw. Somebody’s ignoring their tiny needle teeth, but all right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Try another one.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. What does it say I’m feeling?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sad.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes. I’m looking at a picture of my grandma.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that makes sense, ’cause she’s gone and you miss her.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And you’re worried that turkey neck is in your future. What, now, see, now it says you’re mad. Make up your mind.

utterance.speaker: Raj (on phone)
utterance.content: Okay, Emily. Yeah, sounds great. See you then.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Is that Emily your ex-girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m getting all my exes together in order to discuss why they broke up with me and how I can be a better boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, God. You went through with that? What is wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We are going to find out.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why would you do that, Raj?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I want information in order to improve myself.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re not gonna get information, you’re just gonna get criticism that hurts your feelings.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Don’t worry, I’m a grown man. I have a thick skin.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re so stupid.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, would you take a look at my brother’s résumé? I’m trying to help him clean it up a little.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. He really worked with the Drug Enforcement Agency?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He didn’t know it till he was cuffed, but yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard, if you’re happy and you know it, no need to clap your hands, because I have an emotion detector.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How’s it working out?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Surprisingly well.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s great, I’m happy for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, wait, uh, hold on. Oh, what, you are. Aren’t you sweet?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s that? Are you working on your resume?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, it’s my brother’s. I’m trying to help him get a job out here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, ooh! And that makes Leonard angry.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, Leonard, please. I know an angry face when I see it. It’s this red frowny guy on my phone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? Are you really upset about Randall coming?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I said no.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s like you’re twins.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, if you’re mad about this, just tell me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine. You invited your drug dealer brother to stay with us for God knows how long and didn’t bother to ask me first.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He’s my brother. I didn’t think I needed your permission.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, hey. Now she’s angry, too. This thing works like gangbusters.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not saying you have to ask my permission, but you could have talked to me about it before you said it was okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Like you talked to me about your gaming room?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Our gaming room. I was gonna put a scented candle in it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He’s still mad.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Stop enjoying their fight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You first.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: If you were this upset, why didn’t you say so when I told you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because I didn’t want to sound like a jerk.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you sound like one now. I don’t see the big deal if my brother comes and stays for a while.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If you get him a job, he’s gonna live here forever!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He would get his own place.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Has he ever had his own place?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did it have a metal toilet next to the bed?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It still counts. You know, how is this any different from you making me live with Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, I shared my Honey Nut Cheerios with you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You gave me a bill at the end of every month.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stay out of this. You and your stupid machine started this fight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You are lucky that this feelings machine doesn’t have feelings.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Come on, Sheldon, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gladly. Can we storm out?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think it loses its impact if we’re chatting about it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. I’ll just give them the finger.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, first off, I want to thank you all so much for coming. Howard is here to interpret for Emily, and to take notes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, he doesn’t think it’s stupid.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, heads up, both of you are named Emily, so we’ll call you red-headed Emily, and you, red-headed Emily, Junior.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, you went out with him. I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, uh, let’s get things started. Um, why don’t we go around the room, say your name, and why you broke up with me. Want to kick it off?

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Um, I’m Lucy, and I broke up with Raj because I have severe social anxiety, and he kept trying to force me into uncomfortable situations.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Like this one?

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I did do that. I can be insensitive to other people’s boundaries. Howard, would you write that down?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Schmuck. Got it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, next?

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Okay. Um, I’m Claire. And I guess I broke up with you because you were just really needy. Also, you were incredibly vain, like, all the time you spent shaping your eyebrows.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, new rule, everybody only gets one. Uh, next?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Ooh, I’m not sure I’m comfortable sharing details about our relationship in front of Howard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh. He’s here to support me, so anything you have to say you can say in front of him.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Okay. Well, whenever you and I were in bed…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Howard, get out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not a chance. So, you were telling us how Raj was terrible in bed.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, dinner’s ready. I made beef loaf, because I know you’re uncomfortable with the non-specificity of meat loaf. Sheldon? Hey, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wish I never tried that device. And I know I said the same thing after the massage chair, but this time I mean it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sorry Leonard and Penny hurt your feelings.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s more than that. It’s me. I always knew I had trouble recognizing other people’s emotions, but that machine just made it so real.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, everybody has things that they need help with. Like me, I can’t see without my glasses. And right now you’re just a, a cute, pink smudge wearing a childish green smudge.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I thought I was getting better at it, but clearly I’m not.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes, you are. There have definitely been days when I was sad and you could tell.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, but that’s shooting fish in a barrel. You’re kind of a sad sack. I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have said that. I’m just upset.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, see, right there, you knew you hurt my feelings. And I’m proud of you, for reasons I’m sure have something to do with my father. And if you don’t like that machine, get rid of it. Because I love you exactly the way you are.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I feel the same way about you. Now, put your glasses back on. You look weird.

utterance.speaker: Howard (translating for other Emily)
utterance.content: I thought you were great, but, oh, my God, you were so dominated by your parents.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, that used to drive me nuts. He’s kind of a mama’s boy.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Kind of?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, that’s enough. Write down loving son.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Can I just say something? Going out with Raj was one of the best things that ever happened to me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, I’ll take you back.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Let me finish. It’s like I needed to go through that experience to know what exactly I don’t want in a man.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, that’s hard to hear, but I’ll still take you back.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You know, the same thing happened to me. After I broke up with Raj, I met Gary, who’s just amazing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry, is that Gary with one R or two?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Would you stop writing? Wait, so, did all of you go on to better relationships after me?

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Without question.

utterance.speaker: Claire
utterance.content: Little before, actually.

utterance.speaker: Howard (responding to other Emily)
utterance.content: Oh, wow. Don’t let him get away.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What did she say?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh, basically, she traded you for Bruce Wayne.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, maybe we should just end this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait, hang on. I just want to point out to everyone here, this is a man who is going to great lengths to better himself. Even at the risk of being humiliated. And I, for one, think that’s very brave.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Honestly, I’m surprised you two didn’t wind up together.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, like you gals, I had to suffer through him to find Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We owe you an apology.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, it’s fine. You needed a suitcase, I wasn’t home, you borrowed a suitcase.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That was six years ago. I’m talking about tonight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Well, I thought we were going in order.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, we got really angry at each other, and you just got caught in the middle of it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And, sorry about the suitcase.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you should be. Your socks were still in it. I had to throw it away. Anyway, I, uh, trust that you’ve resolved your conflict.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, we’re fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm, Penny’s gonna call her dad and tell him it’s not a good time for Randall to visit.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hopefully, he won’t be too upset.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, you’re his little girl, he can’t stay mad at you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He won’t be mad at me. I mean, you’re the one who doesn’t want my brother to come, so…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So you’re gonna throw me under the bus?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I’m gonna throw you so hard, I might actually win a stuffed animal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, guys, it sounds like you’re getting angry again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s because we are.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. I don’t need an emotion machine. I am one.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks, ladies, this was fun. Let’s not wait so long for another bizarre, awkward night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, that was a waste of time. I’m such an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t beat yourself up. That’s what I’m here for.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe I won’t settle down. Maybe I’ll just play the field.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, the field was just here. The field said no.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, come on.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll tell you what. I’ll make you a deal. 30 years from now, if you’re still single and things don’t work out with me and Bernadette, you and I can give it a go.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I appreciate the offer, but if things don’t work out with you two, I’m swooping in on her like a vulture.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Too late. Stuart called dibs.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But theoretically, if you and I were in a gay relationship, how would we tell people? Like, print up announcements?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. What difference does it make?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I want to make sure we get invited to all the parades.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Those do look fun.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, if you want to march in a fishnet crop top, you better lay off that dip.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If you didn’t want me to eat it, why’d you put it out?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It was for the girls. They broke up with me, I don’t care if they get fat.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m not gonna get fat.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, you want to bet? You never exercise.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine. Look, I’ll exercise right now. One, two. These are crunches, by the way.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Very mature. Keep eating like that, you’re gonna have a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay. How about if I eat like this?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re such a child.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, is that any way to talk to your future husband?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, I was being hypothetical, okay? I would never marry you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Please. When you see the ring I pick out, you’re gonna melt.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, right. Wait, is it rose gold? Actually, don’t tell me, I want to be surprised.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, did you wind up sending that machine back?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I did. You know, I’m not even sure how accurate it was. I took it to the train store, it said everyone was sad.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I finally got Halley to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, I just read a study that suggests new mothers are better at sensing emotions for up to two years.
